channel.title: Multi-processing question
channel.description: In windows, Is it possible to let a program use/run on 2 processors instead of one? Because 3D rendering would be a lot faster for me if it was running on both, I am not talking about Affinity(allowing) I am talking about letting it use/run on Both, not just choose one or the other.

item.title: Multi-processing question
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

It automatically does that. It runs at 47-50% of total available resources(using processor(1 or 2) fully) I want to bridge a selected program on both cores. at most 90% because of system use and all that stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Multi-processing question
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I’m not sure how all processors work, especially multiple cores, but wouldn’t it be faster if you can possibly dump all apps on core 1 and just run your program you need to run with speed on core 2?

Read full topic
